pageContext.claim: “We're up $15 trillion, at least, since the election. Fifteen trillion.”
pageContext.analysis: This appears to be based on the performance of the Russell 3000 Index since Trump's inauguration. This index includes nearly 98 percent of U.S. stocks, but the market capitalization of the top U.S. companies is not necessarily an indicator of wealth gains for the general population. Moreover, many of the market gains from the start of the year were wiped out because of Trump's trade tensions with China.
